taskDescription: Drag the words into the correct boxes
resetDropDescription: Are you sure you want to reset this drop zone?
a11yCheck: Check the answers. The responses will be marked as correct, incorrect, or unanswered.
a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.
textField:
People can access the internet using *computers*. 

When you open the internet on your computer, phone, or tablet, you use a program. Sometimes that program is called an *application* (or “app” for short). 

There are different types of applications, or programs, that you can use to access the internet. You can think of them as different “brands” of internet programs, just like there are different brands of soups, shoes, spaghetti sauce, toys, and phones. 

The different “brands” of internet are called *browsers*. Google Chrome is one type of browser; Internet Explorer is another, and Firefox is another one too. iPhone users have Safari as an internet browser, and a lot of computers have Microsoft Edge as an option. 

All of the browser types are very similar, but each one has a few things that make them stand out. 

In our class, we will use *Google Chrome* as our internet Browser. 

If I say that it is time to "close your browser," what I mean is that you should turn off your internet program.
